H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H8446.def: = action by which humans carefully investigate a location

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H5387.def: = someone in a position of high authority in a clan, tribe, or nation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H6290.def: = desert; ◄ located south of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, west of {L:Edom<SDBH:אֱדֹום>} and north of {L:Sinai<SDBH:סִינַי>} desert

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5045.def: =  an area of land located in the south of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples - initially by the Canaanites in {L:Arad<SDBH:עֲרָד>} and the {L:Amelekites<SDBH:עֲמָלֵקִי>}, later, the people of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H4264.def: = open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers

H4013.def: = area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H8082.def: literally: fatling; hence: = a young animal that has been fattened to prepare it for slaughter, either for food or sacrifice

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1061.def: = the earliest agricultural outcomes of the season; ► with an important function in the religious offerings system; ≈ often with a religious connotation

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H8446.def: = action by which humans carefully investigate a location

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H6790.def: = a wilderness area in the {L:Negev<SDBH:נֶגֶב>} on the southern border of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}, near {L:Kadesh-Barnea<SDBH:קָדֵשׁ בַּרְנֵעַ>}

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7340.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H2574.def: = town, area; ◄ on Orontes river in {L:Syria<SDBH:אֲרָם>}; ► capital of {L:Aramean<SDBH:אֲרַמִּי>} kingdom; its inhabitants were relocated to {L:Samaria<SDBH:שֹׁמְרֹון>} by the king of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H5045.def: =  an area of land located in the south of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples - initially by the Canaanites in {L:Arad<SDBH:עֲרָד>} and the {L:Amelekites<SDBH:עֲמָלֵקִי>}, later, the people of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2275.def: = town, formerly known as {L:Kiriath-Arba<SDBH:קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע>}; ◄ territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► assigned to clan of {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}, tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}

H3211.def: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate

H6061.def: = ornament worn around the neck of people and animals

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H6814.def: = town; ◄ located in {L:Nile<SDBH:יְאֹר>} delta of {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}; ► Egyptian capital during 21st and 22nd dynasties; administrative centre of Lower Egypt

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H812.def: = group of flowers or fruits positioned on one stem

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H2156.def: = part of a {L:vine<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>} which grows out of the trunk or a bough

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H811.def: = group of flowers or fruits positioned on one stem

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H4132.def: = long wooden pole ► for carrying heavy objects from one location to another

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H7416.def: = a small tree reaching a height of 3-5 m, with narrow, dark green leaves and thorny branches; its has a red flower and produces red round fruits with a hard skin and tightly-packed pockets of seeds inside; ◄ Punica granatum; ► the seeds can be made into wine; the flower-shaped end of the fruit made it an attractive decoration on stone and in the temple; ≈ associated with love, beauty, and sex

H8384.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree"

H182.def: marker that introduces an object or event that is regarded as directly or indirectly responsible for the event in focus

H811.def: = group of flowers or fruits positioned on one stem

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H567.def: = member of ethnic group; ◄ original inhabitants of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}

H3669.def: = descendant of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}, son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}, son of {L:Noah<SDBH:נֹחַ>} and inhabitant of the country named after them

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3383.def: = river; ◄ flowing from Mount {L:Hermon<SDBH:חֶרְמֹון>} in a southerly direction through the {L:Sea of Galilee<SDBH:כִּנֶּרֶת>} into the {L:Dead Sea<SDBH:יָם־הַמֶּלַח>}
